# status

**Instance Property**

A value that indicates the readiness of a player object for playback.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated var status: AVPlayer.Status { get }
```

## Discussion

If the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayer/Status-swift.enum/failed], check the value of the player’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayer/error] property to determine the nature of the failure. If a player reaches a failed state, you can’t use it for playback, and instead need to create a new instance.

This property is key-value observable.



## Determining player readiness

- **AVPlayer.Status**: Status values that indicate whether a player can successfully play media.
- **error**: An error that caused a failure.
